text: A song of ascents.\f + \fr Ps 125 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
\add are\add* like Mount Zion, which cannot be moved,
\add As\add* mountains \add are\add* round about Jerusalem,
so Yahweh \add is\add* round about his people,
For the scepter of wickedness shall not rest
on the ⸤land⸥\f + \fr 125:3 \ft Literally “lot,” that is, land allotted \f* of the righteous,
their hands to do wickedness.\f + \fr 125:3 \ft Hebrew “in wickedness” \f*
Do good, O Yahweh, to the good,
and to \add those\add* upright in their hearts.
But regarding those who turn aside to their crooked ways,
Yahweh will lead them away with the evildoers.
